## Matrices and Linear Algebra to Remember

**Matrix Multiplication, Inner Dot Product**
$$X^TY = [x_1...X_K]\begin{bmatrix}y_{1}\\
...\\
y_{K}
\end{bmatrix} = \sum_{i=1}^{K} X_iY_i$$

The dimensions of a matrix is measured as row by column, n x K. When multiplying 2 matrices of given dimensions, the inner product of the dimensions must match. The resulting matrix dimensions is the outer product. For example,
A [3x1] matrix
$$x = \begin{bmatrix}x_{1}\\
x_{2}\\
x_{3}
\end{bmatrix}$$

multiplied by a [2x3] matrix
$$A = \begin{bmatrix}u_{1}& v_{1} & w_{1}\\
u_{2}& v_{2} & w_{2}\\
\end{bmatrix}$$

Results in a 2x1 matrix
$$xA = \begin{bmatrix}u_{1}& v_{1} & w_{1}\\
u_{2}& v_{2} & w_{2}\\
\end{bmatrix} 
\begin{bmatrix}x_{1}\\
x_{2}\\
x_{3}
\end{bmatrix}
=
\begin{bmatrix}u_{1}x_{1} + v_{1}x_{2} + w_{1}x_{3}\\
u_{2}x_{1} + v_{2}x_{2} + w_{2}x_{2}\\
\end{bmatrix}
$$
